Class BorrowingService

java.lang.Object
com.library.library_management.services.BorrowingService
@Service public class BorrowingService extends Object
Service layer responsible for handling operations related to borrowing books in the library system.

This service interacts with Data Access Objects (DAOs) to manage borrowing records and update the status of copies in the library database.

It ensures transactional integrity during borrowing operations, such as adding a borrowing record and updating the status of the borrowed copy.

Responsibilities:
  • Insert new borrowing records into the database
  • Update the status of book copies when borrowed

This class is annotated with Service to indicate it is a Spring-managed service component.

See Also:

  • Copy

  • Method Details

    • addBorrowing

      @Transactional public void addBorrowing(Borrowing borrowing)
      Adds a new borrowing record and updates the status of the corresponding copy to "Borrowed."

      The method performs the following actions:

      • Inserts the Borrowing entity into the database using BorrowingDAO.insert(Borrowing)
      • Retrieves the associated Copy entity using CopyDAO.getById(int)
      • If the Copy exists, its status is updated to "Borrowed" using CopyDAO.update(Copy)

      This method is transactional. If any operation within this method fails, the entire transaction is rolled back.

      Parameters:
      borrowing - the Borrowing entity representing the borrowing details
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Borrowing or associated Copy is null
